messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-ntfy extension?
The ComfyUI-ntfy extension adds two nodes to ComfyUI to enable sending ntfy notifications easily, supporting both simple text-based notifications and generating images as attachments.
How can one install the ComfyUI-ntfy extension manually?

To install the ComfyUI-ntfy extension manually, one should change their directory to the custom_nodes folder, then clone the repository with a shallow copy from the specified URL. Alternatively, they can download the ntfy.py file and place it into the custom_nodes directory.
How can ntfy be used with ComfyUI-ntfy?
ntfy notifications can be easily sent using the ComfyUI-ntfy extension, supporting both simple text notifications and the attachment of generated images as topics.
What are the benefits of using the ComfyUI-ntfy extension?
The ComfyUI-ntfy extension facilitates easier access to ntfy notifications via ComfyUI, simplifying the process of sending notifications and the attachment of images.
Can the ComfyUI-ntfy extension be updated?
Yes, the ComfyUI-ntfy extension can be updated through the ComfyUi-ntfy directory by pulling from the repository or downloading the ntfy.py file and replacing it in the custom_nodes directory.
How can one contribute to the ComfyUI-ntfy extension?
One can contribute to the ComfyUI-ntfy extension by submitting a pull request on GitHub, and their contributions will be reviewed and potentially integrated into the extension.
